00125 void SceneNodeProperties::Transform(Mat4x4 *toWorld, Mat4x4 *fromWorld) const
00126 {
00127         if (toWorld)
00128                 *toWorld = m_ToWorld;
00129         
00130         if (fromWorld)
00131                 *fromWorld = m_FromWorld;

00141 SceneNode::~SceneNode()
00142 {
00143         // Get rid of all those pesky kids...
00144         //
00145         // NOTE: Because the kids are all managed by smart pointers, we don't need
00146         //       to iterate the STL list and get rid of them. It just 'works'.
00147         //
00148         //      while (!m_Children.empty())
00149         //      {
00150         //              m_Children.pop_front();
00151         //      }
00152 }

00154 //
00155 // SceneNode::VOnRestore                                        - Chapter 14, page 500
00156 //
00157 HRESULT SceneNode::VOnRestore(Scene *pScene)
00158 {
00159         // This is meant to be called from any class
00160         // that inherits from SceneNode and overloads
00161         // VOnRestore()
00162 
00163         SceneNodeList::iterator i = m_Children.begin();
00164         while (i != m_Children.end())
00165         {
00166                 (*i)->VOnRestore(pScene);
00167                 i++;
00168         }
00169         return S_OK;
00170 }

00173 //
00174 // SceneNode::VSetTransform                                     - Chapter 14, page 500
00175 //
00176 void SceneNode::VSetTransform(const Mat4x4 *toWorld, const Mat4x4 *fromWorld)
00177 {
00178         m_Props.m_ToWorld = *toWorld;
00179         if (!fromWorld)
00180         {
00181                 // Good god this is expensive...why bother???? Look in Chapter 10.
00182                 m_Props.m_FromWorld = m_Props.m_ToWorld.Inverse();
00183         }
00184         else
00185         {
00186                 m_Props.m_FromWorld = *fromWorld;
00187         }
00188 }

00196         return S_OK;
00197 }

00205         return S_OK;

00210 //
00211 // SceneNode::VIsVisible                                - Chapter 14, page 501
00212 //      
00213 bool SceneNode::VIsVisible(Scene *pScene) const
00214 {
00215         // transform the location of this node into the camera space 
00216         // of the camera attached to the scene
00217 
00218         Mat4x4 toWorld, fromWorld;
00219         pScene->GetCamera()->VGet()->Transform(&toWorld, &fromWorld);
00220         Vec3 pos = VGet()->ToWorld().GetPosition();
00221 
00222         pos = fromWorld.Xform(pos);
00223 
00224         Frustum const &frustum = pScene->GetCamera()->GetFrustum();
00225         return frustum.Inside(pos, VGet()->Radius());
00226 }
00227 
00228 //
00229 // SceneNode::VOnUpdate                                 - Chapter 14, page 501
00230 //
00231 HRESULT SceneNode::VOnUpdate(Scene *pScene, DWORD const elapsedMs)
00232 {
00233         // This is meant to be called from any class
00234         // that inherits from SceneNode and overloads
00235         // VOnUpdate()
00236 
00237         SceneNodeList::iterator i = m_Children.begin();
00238         while (i != m_Children.end())
00239         {
00240                 (*i)->VOnUpdate(pScene, elapsedMs);
00241                 i++;
00242         }
00243         return S_OK;
00244 }

00247 //
00248 // SceneNode::VRender                                   - Chapter 14, page 502
00249 //
00250 HRESULT SceneNode::VRender(Scene *pScene)
00251 {
00252         m_Props.m_Material.Use();
00253 
00254         switch (m_Props.m_AlphaType)
00255         {
00256                 case AlphaTexture:
00257                         // Nothing to do here....
00258                         break;
00259 
00260                 case AlphaMaterial:
00261                         DXUTGetD3DDevice()->SetRenderState( D3DRS_COLORVERTEX, true);
00262                         DXUTGetD3DDevice()->SetRenderState( D3DRS_DIFFUSEMATERIALSOURCE, D3DMCS_MATERIAL );
00263                         break;
00264 
00265                 case AlphaVertex:
00266                         assert(0 && _T("Not implemented!"));
00267                         break;
00268         }
00269 
00270         return S_OK;
00271 }
00272 
00273 //
00274 // SceneNode::VRenderChildren                                   - Chapter 14, page 503
00275 //
00276 HRESULT SceneNode::VRenderChildren(Scene *pScene)
00277 {
00278         // Iterate through the children....
00279         SceneNodeList::iterator i = m_Children.begin();
00280         while (i != m_Children.end())
00281         {
00282                 if ((*i)->VPreRender(pScene)==S_OK)
00283                 {
00284                         // You could short-circuit rendering
00285                         // if an object returns E_FAIL from
00286                         // VPreRender()
00287 
00288                         // Don't render this node if you can't see it
00289                         if ((*i)->VIsVisible(pScene))
00290                         {
00291                                 float alpha = (*i)->VGet()->m_Material.GetAlpha();
00292                                 if (alpha==fOPAQUE)
00293                                 {
00294                                         (*i)->VRender(pScene);
00295                                 }
00296                                 else if (alpha!=fTRANSPARENT)
00297                                 {
00298                                         // The object isn't totally transparent...
00299                                         AlphaSceneNode *asn = GCC_NEW AlphaSceneNode;
00300                                         assert(asn);
00301                                         asn->m_pNode = *i;
00302                                         asn->m_Concat = *pScene->GetTopMatrix();
00303                                         
00304                                         Vec4 worldPos(asn->m_Concat.GetPosition());
00305                                         
00306                                         Mat4x4 fromWorld = pScene->GetCamera()->VGet()->FromWorld();
00307 
00308                                         Vec4 screenPos = fromWorld.Xform(worldPos);
00309 
00310                                         asn->m_ScreenZ = screenPos.z;
00311 
00312                                         pScene->AddAlphaSceneNode(asn);
00313                                 }
00314                         }
00315 
00316                         (*i)->VRenderChildren(pScene);
00317                 }
00318                 (*i)->VPostRender(pScene);
00319                 i++;
00320         }
00321 
00322         return S_OK;
00323 }
00324 
00325 
00326 //
00327 // SceneNode::VAddChild                                 - Chapter 14, page 505
00328 //
00329 bool SceneNode::VAddChild(shared_ptr<ISceneNode> kid)
00330 {
00331         m_Children.push_back(kid); 
00332 
00333         // The radius of the sphere should be fixed right here
00334         Vec3 kidPos = kid->VGet()->ToWorld().GetPosition();
00335         Vec3 dir = kidPos - m_Props.ToWorld().GetPosition();
00336         float newRadius = dir.Length() + kid->VGet()->Radius();
00337         if (newRadius > m_Props.m_Radius)
00338                 m_Props.m_Radius = newRadius;
00339         return true; 
00340 }
00341 
00342 //
00343 // SceneNode::VRemoveChild                                      - added post press
00344 //
00345 //   If an actor is destroyed it should be removed from the scene graph.
00346 //   Generally the HumanView will recieve a message saying the actor has been
00347 //   destroyed, and it will then call Scene::RemoveChild which will traverse 
00348 //   the scene graph to find the child that needs removing.
00349 //
00350 bool SceneNode::VRemoveChild(ActorId id)
00351 {
00352         for(SceneNodeList::iterator i=m_Children.begin(); i!=m_Children.end(); ++i)
00353         {
00354                 const SceneNodeProperties* pProps = (*i)->VGet();
00355                 if(pProps->ActorId().valid() && id==*pProps->ActorId())
00356                 {
00357                         i = m_Children.erase(i);        //this can be expensive for vectors
00358                         return true;
00359                 }
00360         }
00361         return false;
00362 }

00387 //
00388 // Scene::OnRender                                      - Chapter 14, page 508
00389 //
00390 HRESULT Scene::OnRender()
00391 {
00392         // The render passes usually go like this 
00393         // 1. Static objects & terrain
00394         // 2. Actors (dynamic objects that can move)
00395         // 3. The Sky
00396         // 4. Anything with Alpha
00397 
00398         if (m_Root && m_Camera)
00399         {
00400                 // The scene root could be anything, but it
00401                 // is usually a SceneNode with the identity
00402                 // matrix
00403 
00404                 m_Camera->SetView(this);
00405 
00406                 if (m_Root->VPreRender(this)==S_OK)
00407                 {
00408                         m_Root->VRender(this);
00409                         m_Root->VRenderChildren(this);
00410                         m_Root->VPostRender(this);
00411                 }
00412         }
00413 
00414         RenderAlphaPass();
00415 
00416         return S_OK;
00417 }       
00418 
00419 
00420 //
00421 // Scene::OnRestore                                     - Chapter 14, page 508
00422 //
00423 HRESULT Scene::OnRestore()
00424 {
00425         if (!m_Root)
00426                 return S_OK;
00427 
00428     // Set up lighting states
00429         // TODO _ This should be a Light, that gets added to a list of lights....
00430         // Some of which would cast shadows...
00431 
00432     D3DLIGHT9 light;
00433     D3DXVECTOR3 vecLightDirUnnormalized(1.0f, -6.0f, 1.0f);
00434 
00435         ZeroMemory( &light, sizeof(D3DLIGHT9) );
00436     light.Type        = D3DLIGHT_DIRECTIONAL;
00437     light.Diffuse.r   = 1.0f;
00438     light.Diffuse.g   = 1.0f;
00439     light.Diffuse.b   = 1.0f;
00440     D3DXVec3Normalize( (D3DXVECTOR3*)&light.Direction, &vecLightDirUnnormalized );
00441     light.Position.x   = 1.0f;
00442     light.Position.y   = -6.0f;
00443     light.Position.z   = 1.0f;
00444     light.Range        = 1000.0f;
00445         
00446         DXUTGetD3DDevice()->SetLight( 0, &light );
00447     DXUTGetD3DDevice()->LightEnable( 0, TRUE );
00448     DXUTGetD3DDevice()->SetRenderState( D3DRS_LIGHTING, TRUE );
00449 
00450         return m_Root->VOnRestore(this);
00451 }
00452 
00453 //
00454 // Scene::OnUpdate                                      - Chapter 14, page 509
00455 //
00456 HRESULT Scene::OnUpdate(const int deltaMilliseconds)
00457 {
00458         static DWORD lastTime = 0;
00459         DWORD elapsedTime = 0;
00460         DWORD now = timeGetTime();
00461 
00462         if (!m_Root)
00463                 return S_OK;
00464 
00465         if (lastTime == 0)
00466         {
00467                 lastTime = now;
00468         }
00469 
00470         elapsedTime = now - lastTime;
00471         lastTime = now;
00472 
00473         return m_Root->VOnUpdate(this, elapsedTime);
00474 }
00475 
00476 //
00477 // Scene::FindActor                                     - Chapter 14, page 511
00478 //
00479 shared_ptr<ISceneNode> Scene::FindActor(ActorId id)
00480 {
00481         SceneActorMap::iterator i = m_ActorMap.find(id);
00482         if (i==m_ActorMap.end())
00483         {
00484                 shared_ptr<ISceneNode> null;
00485                 return null;
00486         }
00487 
00488         return (*i).second;
00489 }

00492 //
00493 // Scene::RenderAlphaPass                                       - Chapter 14, page 511
00494 //
00495 void Scene::RenderAlphaPass()
00496 {
00497         Mat4x4 oldWorld;
00498         DXUTGetD3DDevice()->GetTransform(D3DTS_WORLD, &oldWorld);
00499 
00500         DWORD oldZWriteEnable;
00501         DXUTGetD3DDevice()->GetRenderState(D3DRS_ZWRITEENABLE, &oldZWriteEnable);
00502         DXUTGetD3DDevice()->SetRenderState(D3DRS_ZWRITEENABLE, false);
00503 
00504         DXUTGetD3DDevice()->SetRenderState(D3DRS_ALPHABLENDENABLE, true);
00505         DXUTGetD3DDevice()->SetRenderState(D3DRS_SRCBLEND, D3DBLEND_SRCCOLOR);
00506     DXUTGetD3DDevice()->SetRenderState(D3DRS_DESTBLEND, D3DBLEND_INVSRCCOLOR);
00507 
00508         // Texture stage states
00509 
00510         m_AlphaSceneNodes.sort();
00511         while (!m_AlphaSceneNodes.empty())
00512         {
00513                 AlphaSceneNodes::reverse_iterator i = m_AlphaSceneNodes.rbegin();
00514                 DXUTGetD3DDevice()->SetTransform(D3DTS_WORLD, &((*i)->m_Concat));
00515                 (*i)->m_pNode->VRender(this);
00516                 delete (*i);
00517                 m_AlphaSceneNodes.pop_back();
00518         }
00519 
00520         DXUTGetD3DDevice()->SetRenderState( D3DRS_COLORVERTEX, false);
00521         DXUTGetD3DDevice()->SetRenderState(D3DRS_ALPHABLENDENABLE, false);
00522 
00523         DXUTGetD3DDevice()->SetRenderState(D3DRS_ZWRITEENABLE, oldZWriteEnable);
00524 
00525         DXUTGetD3DDevice()->SetTransform(D3DTS_WORLD, &oldWorld);
00526 
00527 }

00532 // RootNode Implementation
00534 
00535 //
00536 // RootNode::RootNode                                   - Chapter 14, page 513
00537 //
00538 RootNode::RootNode()
00539 : SceneNode(optional_empty(), "Root", RenderPass_0, &Mat4x4::g_Identity)
00540 {
00541         m_Children.reserve(RenderPass_Last);
00542 
00543         shared_ptr<SceneNode> staticGroup(GCC_NEW SceneNode(optional_empty(), "StaticGroup", RenderPass_Static, &Mat4x4::g_Identity));
00544         m_Children.push_back(staticGroup);      // RenderPass_Static = 0
00545 
00546         shared_ptr<SceneNode> actorGroup(GCC_NEW SceneNode(optional_empty(), "ActorGroup", RenderPass_Actor, &Mat4x4::g_Identity));
00547         m_Children.push_back(actorGroup);       // RenderPass_Actor = 1
00548 
00549         shared_ptr<SceneNode> skyGroup(GCC_NEW SceneNode(optional_empty(), "SkyGroup", RenderPass_Sky, &Mat4x4::g_Identity));
00550         m_Children.push_back(skyGroup); // RenderPass_Sky = 2
00551 }
00552 
00553 //
00554 // RootNode::VAddChild                                  - Chapter 14, page 514
00555 //
00556 bool RootNode::VAddChild(shared_ptr<ISceneNode> kid)
00557 {
00558         // The Root node has children that divide the scene graph into render passes.
00559         // Scene nodes will get added to these children based on the value of the
00560         // render pass member variable.
00561 
00562         if (!m_Children[kid->VGet()->RenderPass()])
00563         {
00564                 assert(0 && _T("There is no such render pass"));
00565                 return false;
00566         }
00567 
00568         return m_Children[kid->VGet()->RenderPass()]->VAddChild(kid);
00569 }
00570 
00571 //
00572 // RootNode::VRemoveChild                                       - added post-press
00573 //
00574 //   Returns false if nothing was removed
00575 //
00576 bool RootNode::VRemoveChild(ActorId id)
00577 {
00578         bool anythingRemoved = false;
00579         for(int i=RenderPass_0; i<RenderPass_Last; ++i)
00580         {
00581                 if(m_Children[i]->VRemoveChild(id))
00582                 {
00583                         anythingRemoved = true;
00584                 }
00585         }
00586         return anythingRemoved;
00587 }
00588 
00589 //
00590 // RootNode::VRenderChildren                                    - Chapter 14, page 514
00591 //
00592 HRESULT RootNode::VRenderChildren(Scene *pScene)
00593 {
00594         // This code creates fine control of the render passes.
00595 
00596         for (int pass = RenderPass_0; pass < RenderPass_Last; ++pass)
00597         {
00598                 switch(pass)
00599                 {
00600                         case RenderPass_Static:
00601                         case RenderPass_Actor:
00602                                 m_Children[pass]->VRenderChildren(pScene);
00603                                 break;
00604 
00605                         case RenderPass_Sky:
00606                         {
00607                                 DWORD oldZWriteEnable;
00608                                 DXUTGetD3DDevice()->GetRenderState(D3DRS_ZWRITEENABLE, &oldZWriteEnable);
00609                                 DXUTGetD3DDevice()->SetRenderState(D3DRS_ZWRITEENABLE, false);
00610 
00611                                 DWORD oldLightMode;
00612                                 DXUTGetD3DDevice()->GetRenderState( D3DRS_LIGHTING, &oldLightMode );
00613                                 DXUTGetD3DDevice()->SetRenderState( D3DRS_LIGHTING, FALSE );
00614 
00615                                 DWORD oldCullMode;
00616                                 DXUTGetD3DDevice()->GetRenderState( D3DRS_CULLMODE, &oldCullMode );
00617                                 DXUTGetD3DDevice()->SetRenderState( D3DRS_CULLMODE, D3DCULL_NONE );
00618 
00619                                 m_Children[pass]->VRenderChildren(pScene);
00620 
00621                                 // Notice that the render states are returned to 
00622                                 // their original settings.....
00623                                 // Could there be a better way???
00624 
00625                                 DXUTGetD3DDevice()->SetRenderState( D3DRS_LIGHTING, oldLightMode );
00626                                 DXUTGetD3DDevice()->SetRenderState( D3DRS_CULLMODE, oldCullMode );
00627 
00628                                 DXUTGetD3DDevice()->SetRenderState(D3DRS_ZWRITEENABLE, oldZWriteEnable);
00629                                 break;
00630                         }
00631                 }
00632         }
00633 
00634         return S_OK;
00635 }

00639 // CameraNode Implementation
00641 
00642 
00643 //
00644 // CameraNode::VRender                                  - Chapter 14, page 516
00645 //
00646 HRESULT CameraNode::VRender(Scene *pScene)
00647 {
00648         if (m_DebugCamera)
00649         {
00650                 pScene->PopMatrix();
00651 
00652                 m_Frustum.Render();     
00653 
00654                 pScene->PushAndSetMatrix(m_Props.ToWorld());
00655         }
00656 
00657         return S_OK;
00658 } 
00659 
00660 //
00661 // CameraNode::VOnRestore                                       - Chapter 14, page 517
00662 //
00663 HRESULT CameraNode::VOnRestore(Scene *pScene)
00664 {
00665         m_Frustum.SetAspect(
00666                 DXUTGetBackBufferSurfaceDesc()->Width / 
00667                 (FLOAT)DXUTGetBackBufferSurfaceDesc()->Height);
00668         D3DXMatrixPerspectiveFovLH( &m_Projection, m_Frustum.m_Fov, m_Frustum.m_Aspect, m_Frustum.m_Near, m_Frustum.m_Far );            
00669         DXUTGetD3DDevice()->SetTransform( D3DTS_PROJECTION, &m_Projection );
00670         return S_OK;
00671 }
00672 
00673 //
00674 // CameraNode::SetView                                  - Chapter 14, page 517
00675 //
00676 HRESULT CameraNode::SetView(Scene *pScene)
00677 {
00678         //If there is a target, make sure the camera is
00679         //rigidly attached right behind the target
00680         if(m_pTarget.valid())
00681         {
00682                 Mat4x4 mat = (*m_pTarget)->VGet()->ToWorld();
00683                 Vec4 at = g_Forward4 * -10.0f;
00684                 Vec4 atWorld = mat.Xform(at);
00685                 Vec3 pos = mat.GetPosition() + Vec3(atWorld);
00686                 mat.SetPosition(pos);
00687                 VSetTransform(&mat);
00688         }
00689 
00690         DXUTGetD3DDevice()->SetTransform( D3DTS_VIEW, &VGet()->FromWorld() );
00691         return S_OK;
00692 }

00700 // MeshNode Implementation
00702 
00703 //
00704 // MeshNode::MeshNode                           - Chapter 14, page 525
00705 //
00706 MeshNode::MeshNode(const optional<ActorId> actorId, 
00707         std::string name, 
00708         ID3DXMesh *mesh, 
00709         RenderPass renderPass, 
00710         const Mat4x4 *t, 
00711         const Color &color)
00712  : SceneNode(actorId, name, renderPass, t) 
00713 { 
00714         m_pMesh = mesh;  
00715         m_pMesh->AddRef(); 
00716 
00717         Material mat;
00718         mat.Set(color);
00719         SetMaterial(mat);
00720 
00721         SetRadius(CalcBoundingSphere());
00722 }

00724 //
00725 // MeshNode::MeshNode                           - Chapter 14, page 525
00726 //
00727 MeshNode::MeshNode(const optional<ActorId> actorId, 
00728         std::string name, 
00729         std::wstring xFileName, 
00730         RenderPass renderPass, 
00731         const Mat4x4 *t, 
00732         const Color &color)
00733  : SceneNode(actorId, name, renderPass, t) 
00734 { 
00735         m_pMesh = NULL;
00736         m_XFileName = xFileName;
00737 
00738         Material mat;
00739         mat.Set(color);
00740         SetMaterial(mat);
00741 }
00742 
00743 //
00744 // MeshNode::CalcBoundingSphere                         - Chapter 14, page 525
00745 //
00746 float MeshNode::CalcBoundingSphere()
00747 {
00748         HRESULT hr;
00749 
00750     // Find the mesh's center, then generate a centering matrix.
00751     IDirect3DVertexBuffer9* pVB = NULL;
00752     V_RETURN( m_pMesh->GetVertexBuffer( &pVB ) );
00753 
00754     void* pVertices = NULL;
00755     hr = pVB->Lock( 0, 0, &pVertices, 0 );
00756     if( FAILED(hr) )
00757     {
00758         SAFE_RELEASE( pVB );
00759         return hr;
00760     }
00761 
00762         Vec3 center;
00763         float radius;
00764     hr = D3DXComputeBoundingSphere( (D3DXVECTOR3*)pVertices, m_pMesh->GetNumVertices(),
00765                                     D3DXGetFVFVertexSize(m_pMesh->GetFVF()), &center,
00766                                     &radius );
00767     pVB->Unlock();
00768     SAFE_RELEASE( pVB );
00769 
00770         return radius;
00771 }
00772 
00773 
00774 //
00775 // MeshNode::VRender                            - Chapter 14, page 526
00776 //
00777 HRESULT MeshNode::VRender(Scene *pScene)
00778 {
00779         if (S_OK != SceneNode::VRender(pScene) )
00780                 return E_FAIL;
00781 
00782 
00783         return m_pMesh->DrawSubset(0); 
00784 } 
00785 
00786 //
00787 // MeshNode::VOnRestore                         - Chapter 14, page 527
00788 //
00789 // This function loads the mesh and ensures the mesh has normals; it also optimizes the 
00790 // mesh for the graphics card's vertex cache, which improves performance by organizing 
00791 // the internal triangle list for less cache misses.
00792 //
00793 HRESULT MeshNode::VOnRestore(Scene *pScene)
00794 {
00795         if (m_XFileName.empty())
00796         {
00797                 SetRadius(CalcBoundingSphere());
00798                 return S_OK;
00799         }
00800 
00801         SAFE_RELEASE(m_pMesh);
00802 
00803     WCHAR str[MAX_PATH];
00804     HRESULT hr;
00805 
00806     // Load the mesh with D3DX and get back a ID3DXMesh*.  For this
00807     // sample we'll ignore the X file's embedded materials since we know 
00808     // exactly the model we're loading.  See the mesh samples such as
00809     // "OptimizedMesh" for a more generic mesh loading example.
00810         V_RETURN( DXUTFindDXSDKMediaFileCch( str, MAX_PATH, m_XFileName.c_str() ) );
00811 
00812     V_RETURN( D3DXLoadMeshFromX(str, D3DXMESH_MANAGED, DXUTGetD3DDevice(), NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, &m_pMesh) );
00813 
00814     DWORD *rgdwAdjacency = NULL;
00815 
00816     // Make sure there are normals which are required for lighting
00817     if( !(m_pMesh->GetFVF() & D3DFVF_NORMAL) )
00818     {
00819         ID3DXMesh* pTempMesh;
00820         V( m_pMesh->CloneMeshFVF( m_pMesh->GetOptions(), 
00821                                   m_pMesh->GetFVF() | D3DFVF_NORMAL, 
00822                                   DXUTGetD3DDevice(), &pTempMesh ) );
00823         V( D3DXComputeNormals( pTempMesh, NULL ) );
00824 
00825         SAFE_RELEASE( m_pMesh );
00826         m_pMesh = pTempMesh;
00827     }
00828 
00829     // Optimize the mesh for this graphics card's vertex cache 
00830     // so when rendering the mesh's triangle list the vertices will 
00831     // cache hit more often so it won't have to re-execute the vertex shader 
00832     // on those vertices so it will improve perf.     
00833 
00834     rgdwAdjacency = GCC_NEW DWORD[m_pMesh->GetNumFaces() * 3];
00835     if( rgdwAdjacency == NULL )
00836         return E_OUTOFMEMORY;
00837     V( m_pMesh->ConvertPointRepsToAdjacency(NULL, rgdwAdjacency) );
00838     V( m_pMesh->OptimizeInplace(D3DXMESHOPT_VERTEXCACHE, rgdwAdjacency, NULL, NULL, NULL) );
00839     
00840         SAFE_DELETE_ARRAY(rgdwAdjacency);
00841 
00842         SetRadius(CalcBoundingSphere());
00843 
00844     return S_OK;
00845 }
00846

00850 // Grid Implementation
00852 
00853 //
00854 // Grid::Grid                                           - Chapter 13, page 468
00855 // Grid::Grid                                           - Chapter 14, page 519
00856 //
00857 Grid::Grid(optional<ActorId> actorId,
00858                    std::string name,
00859                    const GridParams &params)
00860         : SceneNode(actorId, name, RenderPass_0, &params.m_Mat)
00861 {
00862         m_params = params;
00863 
00864         m_bTextureHasAlpha = false;
00865 
00866         m_pTexture = NULL;
00867         m_pVerts = NULL;
00868         m_pIndices = NULL;
00869         m_numVerts = m_numPolys = 0;
00870 }
00871 
00872 //
00873 // Grid::~Grid                                          - Chapter 13, page 468
00874 // Grid::~Grid                                          - Chapter 14, page 519
00875 //
00876 Grid::~Grid()
00877 {
00878         SAFE_RELEASE(m_pTexture);       
00879         SAFE_RELEASE(m_pVerts);
00880         SAFE_RELEASE(m_pIndices);
00881 }
00882 
00883 //
00884 // Grid::Create                                         - Chapter 13, page 468
00885 // Grid::VOnRestore                                     - Chapter 14, page 519
00886 //
00887 //      Here's a list of changes that were made from Chapter 13 to Chapter 14.
00888 //      1. The resource cache is used to hold the texture file.
00889 //              2. The texture file isn't hard coded - it is stored in a member variable
00890 //              3. SetRadius() is called with the spherical dimensions of this grid to aid culling
00891 //              4. The input parameter was changed to a platform independant Scene object
00892 //
00893 HRESULT Grid::VOnRestore(Scene *pScene)
00894 {
00895         // Call the base class's restore
00896         SceneNode::VOnRestore(pScene);
00897 
00898         Resource resource(m_params.m_Texture);
00899         int size = g_pApp->m_ResCache->Create(resource);
00900         assert(size);
00901         char *textureBuffer = (char *)g_pApp->m_ResCache->Get(resource);
00902         if ( FAILED ( D3DXCreateTextureFromFileInMemory( DXUTGetD3DDevice(), textureBuffer, resource.m_size, &m_pTexture ) ) )
00903                 return E_FAIL;
00904 
00905         SetRadius( sqrt(m_params.m_Squares * m_params.m_Squares / 2.0f) );
00906 
00907     // Create the vertex buffer - we'll need enough verts
00908         // to populate the grid. If we want a 2x2 grid, we'll
00909         // need 3x3 set of verts.
00910         m_numVerts = (m_params.m_Squares+1)*(m_params.m_Squares+1);
00911 
00912     if( FAILED( DXUTGetD3DDevice()->CreateVertexBuffer( 
00913                 m_numVerts*sizeof(COLORED_TEXTURED_VERTEX),
00914                 D3DUSAGE_WRITEONLY, COLORED_TEXTURED_VERTEX::FVF,
00915         D3DPOOL_MANAGED, &m_pVerts, NULL ) ) )
00916     {
00917         return E_FAIL;
00918     }
00919 
00920     // Fill the vertex buffer. We are setting the tu and tv texture
00921     // coordinates, which range from 0.0 to 1.0
00922     COLORED_TEXTURED_VERTEX* pVertices;
00923     if( FAILED( m_pVerts->Lock( 0, 0, (void**)&pVertices, 0 ) ) )
00924         return E_FAIL;
00925 
00926         for( DWORD j=0; j<(m_params.m_Squares+1); j++ )
00927     {
00928                 for (DWORD i=0; i<(m_params.m_Squares+1); i++)
00929                 {
00930                         // Which vertex are we setting?
00931                         int index = i + (j * (m_params.m_Squares+1) );
00932                         COLORED_TEXTURED_VERTEX *vert = &pVertices[index];
00933 
00934                         // Default position of the grid is centered on the origin, flat on
00935                         // the XZ plane.
00936                         float x = (float)i - (m_params.m_Squares/2.0f);
00937                         float y = (float)j - (m_params.m_Squares/2.0f);
00938                         vert->position = ( x * Vec3(1,0,0) ) + ( y * Vec3(0,0,1) );
00939                         vert->color    = m_params.m_Color;
00940 
00941                         // The texture coordinates are set to x,y to make the
00942                         // texture tile along with units - 1.0, 2.0, 3.0, etc.
00943                         vert->tu       = x;
00944                         vert->tv       = y;
00945                 }
00946         }
00947     m_pVerts->Unlock();
00948 
00949         // The number of indicies equals the number of polygons times 3
00950         // since there are 3 indicies per polygon. Each grid square contains
00951         // two polygons. The indicies are 16 bit, since our grids won't
00952         // be that big!
00953         m_numPolys = m_params.m_Squares*m_params.m_Squares*2;
00954         if( FAILED( DXUTGetD3DDevice()->CreateIndexBuffer(sizeof(WORD) * m_numPolys * 3,
00955                                 D3DUSAGE_WRITEONLY, D3DFMT_INDEX16, D3DPOOL_MANAGED, &m_pIndices, NULL ) ) )
00956         {
00957                 return E_FAIL;
00958         }
00959 
00960     WORD *pIndices;
00961     if( FAILED( m_pIndices->Lock( 0, 0, (void**)&pIndices, 0 ) ) )
00962         return E_FAIL;
00963         
00964         // Loop through the grid squares and calc the values
00965         // of each index. Each grid square has two triangles:
00966         //
00967         //              A - B
00968         //              | / |
00969         //              C - D
00970 
00971         for( DWORD j=0; j<m_params.m_Squares; j++ )
00972     {
00973                 for (DWORD i=0; i<m_params.m_Squares; i++)
00974                 {
00975                         // Triangle #1  ACB
00976                         *(pIndices) = WORD(i + (j*(m_params.m_Squares+1)));
00977                         *(pIndices+1) = WORD(i + ((j+1)*(m_params.m_Squares+1)));
00978                         *(pIndices+2) = WORD((i+1) + (j*(m_params.m_Squares+1)));
00979 
00980                         // Triangle #2  BCD
00981                         *(pIndices+3) = WORD((i+1) + (j*(m_params.m_Squares+1)));
00982                         *(pIndices+4) = WORD(i + ((j+1)*(m_params.m_Squares+1)));
00983                         *(pIndices+5) = WORD((i+1) + ((j+1)*(m_params.m_Squares+1)));
00984                         pIndices+=6;
00985                 }
00986         }
00987         
00988     m_pIndices->Unlock();
00989         return S_OK;
00990 }
00991 
00992 //
00993 // Grid::Render                                         - Chapter 13, page 470
00994 // Grid::VRender                                        - Chapter 14, page 521
00995 //
00996 //
00997 HRESULT Grid::VRender(Scene *pScene)
00998 {
00999         // This is slightly different from the Chapter 7 implementation...
01000 
01001         DWORD oldLightMode;
01002         DXUTGetD3DDevice()->GetRenderState( D3DRS_LIGHTING, &oldLightMode );
01003         DXUTGetD3DDevice()->SetRenderState( D3DRS_LIGHTING, FALSE );
01004 
01005         DWORD oldCullMode;
01006         DXUTGetD3DDevice()->GetRenderState( D3DRS_CULLMODE, &oldCullMode );
01007         DXUTGetD3DDevice()->SetRenderState( D3DRS_CULLMODE, D3DCULL_NONE );
01008 
01009         // Setup our texture. Using textures introduces the texture stage states,
01010     // which govern how textures get blended together (in the case of multiple
01011     // textures) and lighting information. In this case, we are modulating
01012     // (blending) our texture with the diffuse color of the vertices.
01013 
01014         DXUTGetD3DDevice()->SetTexture( 0, m_pTexture );
01015 
01016         if (m_bTextureHasAlpha)
01017         {
01018                 DXUTGetD3DDevice()->SetTextureStageState(0, D3DTSS_COLORARG1, D3DTA_TEXTURE);
01019                 DXUTGetD3DDevice()->SetTextureStageState(0, D3DTSS_COLORARG2, D3DTA_DIFFUSE);  
01020                         
01021                 DXUTGetD3DDevice()->SetTextureStageState(0, D3DTSS_COLOROP, D3DTOP_MODULATE);
01022                         
01023                 DXUTGetD3DDevice()->SetTextureStageState(0, D3DTSS_ALPHAARG1, D3DTA_TEXTURE);
01024                 DXUTGetD3DDevice()->SetTextureStageState(0, D3DTSS_ALPHAARG2, D3DTA_DIFFUSE);
01025 
01026                 DXUTGetD3DDevice()->SetTextureStageState(0, D3DTSS_ALPHAOP, D3DTOP_MODULATE);
01027         }
01028         else
01029         {
01030                 DXUTGetD3DDevice()->SetTextureStageState( 0, D3DTSS_COLOROP,   D3DTOP_MODULATE );
01031                 DXUTGetD3DDevice()->SetTextureStageState( 0, D3DTSS_COLORARG1, D3DTA_TEXTURE );
01032                 DXUTGetD3DDevice()->SetTextureStageState( 0, D3DTSS_COLORARG2, D3DTA_DIFFUSE );
01033         }
01034 
01035         DXUTGetD3DDevice()->SetStreamSource( 0, m_pVerts, 0, sizeof(COLORED_TEXTURED_VERTEX) );
01036         DXUTGetD3DDevice()->SetIndices(m_pIndices);
01037         DXUTGetD3DDevice()->SetFVF( COLORED_TEXTURED_VERTEX::FVF );
01038         DXUTGetD3DDevice()->DrawIndexedPrimitive( D3DPT_TRIANGLELIST , 0, 0, m_numVerts, 0, m_numPolys );
01039 
01040         // Notice that the render states are returned to 
01041         // their original settings.....
01042         // Could there be a better way???
01043 
01044         DXUTGetD3DDevice()->SetTexture (0, NULL);
01045         DXUTGetD3DDevice()->SetRenderState( D3DRS_LIGHTING, oldLightMode );
01046         DXUTGetD3DDevice()->SetRenderState( D3DRS_CULLMODE, oldCullMode );
01047 
01048         return S_OK;
01049 }
01050

01057 
01058 //
01059 // SkyNode::SkyNode                             - Chapter 14, page 529
01060 //
01061 SkyNode::SkyNode(const char *pTextureBaseName, shared_ptr<CameraNode> camera)
01062 : SceneNode(optional_empty(), "Sky", RenderPass_Sky, &Mat4x4::g_Identity)
01063 , m_camera(camera)
01064 , m_bActive(true)
01065 {
01066         m_textureBaseName = pTextureBaseName;
01067         for (int i=0; i<5; ++i)
01068         {
01069                 m_pTexture[i] = NULL;
01070         }
01071 }
01072 
01073 
01074 //
01075 // SkyNode::~SkyNode                            - Chapter 14, page 529
01076 //
01077 SkyNode::~SkyNode()
01078 {
01079         for (int i=0; i<5; ++i)
01080         {
01081                 SAFE_RELEASE(m_pTexture[i]);
01082         }
01083         SAFE_RELEASE(m_pVerts);
01084 }
01085 
01086 //
01087 // SkyNode::VOnRestore                          - Chapter 14, page 529
01088 //
01089 HRESULT SkyNode::VOnRestore(Scene *pScene)
01090 {
01091         // Call the base class's restore
01092         SceneNode::VOnRestore(pScene);
01093 
01094         const char *suffix[] = { "_n.jpg", "_e.jpg",  "_s.jpg",  "_w.jpg",  "_u.jpg" };
01095         for (int i=0; i<5; ++i)
01096         {
01097                 char name[256];
01098                 strcpy(name, m_textureBaseName);
01099                 strcat(name, suffix[i]);
01100 
01101                 Resource resource(name);
01102                 int size = g_pApp->m_ResCache->Create(resource);
01103                 assert(size);
01104                 char *textureBuffer = (char *)g_pApp->m_ResCache->Get(resource);
01105                 if ( FAILED ( D3DXCreateTextureFromFileInMemory( DXUTGetD3DDevice(), textureBuffer, resource.m_size, &m_pTexture[i] ) ) )
01106                         return E_FAIL;
01107         }
01108 
01109         m_numVerts = 20;
01110 
01111     if( FAILED( DXUTGetD3DDevice()->CreateVertexBuffer( 
01112                 m_numVerts*sizeof(COLORED_TEXTURED_VERTEX),
01113                 D3DUSAGE_WRITEONLY, COLORED_TEXTURED_VERTEX::FVF,
01114         D3DPOOL_MANAGED, &m_pVerts, NULL ) ) )
01115     {
01116         return E_FAIL;
01117     }
01118 
01119     // Fill the vertex buffer. We are setting the tu and tv texture
01120     // coordinates, which range from 0.0 to 1.0
01121     COLORED_TEXTURED_VERTEX* pVertices;
01122     if( FAILED( m_pVerts->Lock( 0, 0, (void**)&pVertices, 0 ) ) )
01123         return E_FAIL;
01124 
01125         // Loop through the grid squares and calc the values
01126         // of each index. Each grid square has two triangles:
01127         //
01128         //              A - B
01129         //              | / |
01130         //              C - D
01131 
01132         COLORED_TEXTURED_VERTEX skyVerts[4];
01133         D3DCOLOR skyVertColor = 0xffffffff;
01134         float dim = 50.0f;
01135 
01136         skyVerts[0].position = Vec3( dim, dim, dim ); skyVerts[0].color=skyVertColor; skyVerts[0].tu=1; skyVerts[0].tv=0; 
01137         skyVerts[1].position = Vec3(-dim, dim, dim ); skyVerts[1].color=skyVertColor; skyVerts[1].tu=0; skyVerts[1].tv=0; 
01138         skyVerts[2].position = Vec3( dim,-dim, dim ); skyVerts[2].color=skyVertColor; skyVerts[2].tu=1; skyVerts[2].tv=1; 
01139         skyVerts[3].position = Vec3(-dim,-dim, dim ); skyVerts[3].color=skyVertColor; skyVerts[3].tu=0; skyVerts[3].tv=1; 
01140 
01141         Mat4x4 rotY;
01142         rotY.BuildRotationY(D3DX_PI/2.0f);
01143         Mat4x4 rotX;
01144         rotX.BuildRotationX(-D3DX_PI/2.0f);
01145         
01146         m_sides = 5;
01147 
01148         for (DWORD side = 0; side < m_sides; side++)
01149         {
01150                 for (DWORD v = 0; v < 4; v++)
01151                 {
01152                         Vec4 temp;
01153                         if (side < m_sides-1)
01154                         {
01155                                 temp = rotY.Xform(Vec3(skyVerts[v].position));
01156                         }
01157                         else
01158                         {
01159                                 skyVerts[0].tu=1; skyVerts[0].tv=1; 
01160                                 skyVerts[1].tu=1; skyVerts[1].tv=0; 
01161                                 skyVerts[2].tu=0; skyVerts[2].tv=1; 
01162                                 skyVerts[3].tu=0; skyVerts[3].tv=0; 
01163 
01164                                 temp = rotX.Xform(Vec3(skyVerts[v].position));
01165                         }
01166                         skyVerts[v].position = Vec3(temp.x, temp.y, temp.z);
01167                 }
01168                 memcpy(&pVertices[side*4], skyVerts, sizeof(skyVerts));
01169         }
01170 
01171         m_pVerts->Unlock();
01172         return S_OK;
01173 }
01174 
01175 //
01176 // SkyNode::VPreRender                          - Chapter 14, page 532
01177 //
01178 HRESULT SkyNode::VPreRender(Scene *pScene)
01179 {
01180         Vec3 cameraPos = m_camera->VGet()->ToWorld().GetPosition();
01181         Mat4x4 mat = m_Props.ToWorld();
01182         mat.SetPosition(cameraPos);
01183         VSetTransform(&mat);
01184 
01185         return SceneNode::VPreRender(pScene);
01186 }
01187 
01188 
01189 //
01190 // SkyNode::VRender                             - Chapter 14, page 532
01191 //
01192 HRESULT SkyNode::VRender(Scene *pScene)
01193 {
01194 
01195         // Setup our texture. Using textures introduces the texture stage states,
01196     // which govern how textures get blended together (in the case of multiple
01197     // textures) and lighting information. In this case, we are modulating
01198     // (blending) our texture with the diffuse color of the vertices.
01199 
01200     DXUTGetD3DDevice()->SetTextureStageState( 0, D3DTSS_COLOROP,   D3DTOP_MODULATE );
01201     DXUTGetD3DDevice()->SetTextureStageState( 0, D3DTSS_COLORARG1, D3DTA_TEXTURE );
01202     DXUTGetD3DDevice()->SetTextureStageState( 0, D3DTSS_COLORARG2, D3DTA_DIFFUSE );
01203 
01204         DXUTGetD3DDevice()->SetStreamSource( 0, m_pVerts, 0, sizeof(COLORED_TEXTURED_VERTEX) );
01205         DXUTGetD3DDevice()->SetFVF( COLORED_TEXTURED_VERTEX::FVF );
01206 
01207         for (DWORD side = 0; side < m_sides; side++)
01208         {
01209                 // TODO: A good optimization would be to transform the camera's
01210                 // world look vector into local space, and do a dot product. If the
01211                 // result is positive, we shouldn't draw the side since it has to be
01212                 // behind the camera!
01213 
01214                 // Sky boxes aren't culled by the normal mechanism
01215 
01216                 DXUTGetD3DDevice()->SetTexture( 0, m_pTexture[side] );
01217                 DXUTGetD3DDevice()->DrawPrimitive( D3DPT_TRIANGLESTRIP , 4 * side, 2);
01218         }
01219 
01220         DXUTGetD3DDevice()->SetTexture (0, NULL);
01221         return S_OK;
01222 }
01223 
01225 // ArrowNode Implementation - added post press
01227 
01228 ArrowNode::ArrowNode(std::string name, const float length, const Mat4x4 *t, const Color &color) 
01229         : SceneNode(optional_empty(), name, RenderPass_0, t) 
01230 { 
01231     D3DXCreateCylinder( DXUTGetD3DDevice(), 0.1f * length, 0.0f, 0.3f * length, 16, 1, &m_cone, NULL);
01232         D3DXCreateCylinder( DXUTGetD3DDevice(), 0.05f * length, 0.05f * length, 0.7f * length, 16, 2, &m_shaft, NULL);
01233 
01234         m_coneTrans.BuildTranslation( 0, 0, (0.7f + 0.15f) * length);
01235         m_shaftTrans.BuildTranslation( 0, 0, (0.35f * length));
01236 
01237         Material mat;
01238         mat.Set(color);
01239         SetMaterial(mat);
01240 
01241         // The anchor point is at 0,0,0 - so the radius must incorporate the whole length.
01242         SetRadius(length);
01243 }
01244 
01245 HRESULT ArrowNode::VRender(Scene *pScene)
01246 {
01247         if (S_OK != SceneNode::VRender(pScene) )
01248                 return E_FAIL;
01249 
01250 
01251         pScene->PushAndSetMatrix(m_shaftTrans);
01252 
01253         m_shaft->DrawSubset(0); 
01254         pScene->PopMatrix();
01255 
01256         pScene->PushAndSetMatrix(m_coneTrans);
01257         m_cone->DrawSubset(0);
01258 
01259         pScene->PopMatrix();
01260         return S_OK;
01261 }

01280 }

01286 }
01287 
01288 
01289 Vec3 TestObject::g_TestObjectVerts[] = 
01290 {
01291         Vec3(0,0,0),                    //0
01292         Vec3(0.5, 0, 0.25),             //1
01293         Vec3(1,0,1),                    //2
01294         Vec3(0,0,1),                    //3
01295         Vec3(0,0.5,0),                  //4
01296         Vec3(0.5, 0.5, 0.25),   //5
01297         Vec3(1,1,1),                    //6
01298         Vec3(0,1,1)                             //7
01299 };
01300 
01301 // We're doing little triangle strips
01302 WORD TestObject::g_TestObjectIndices[][4] = 
01303 {
01304         { 0, 1, 4, 5 }, 
01305         { 5, 1, 6, 2 },
01306         { 3, 0, 7, 4 },
01307         { 6, 2, 7, 3 },
01308         { 4, 5, 7, 6 },
01309         { 0, 3, 1, 2 },
01310 };
01311 
01312 
01313 HRESULT TestObject::VOnRestore(Scene *pScene)
01314 {
01315         // Call the base class's restore
01316         SceneNode::VOnRestore(pScene);
01317 
01318         Vec3 center;
01319         float radius;
01320         HRESULT hr = D3DXComputeBoundingSphere( 
01321                 static_cast<D3DXVECTOR3*>(g_TestObjectVerts), 8,
01322         D3DXGetFVFVertexSize(D3DFVF_XYZ), 
01323                 &center, &radius );
01324 
01325         SetRadius(radius);
01326 
01327     // Create the vertex buffer - this object is essentailly 
01328         // a squashed cube, but since we want each face to be flat shaded
01329         // each face needs its own set of verts - because each vert has a normal
01330         // and thus can't have any vert shared by adjacent faces.
01331         m_numVerts = 6 * 4;
01332         m_numPolys = 12;
01333 
01334     if( FAILED( DXUTGetD3DDevice()->CreateVertexBuffer( 
01335                 m_numVerts*sizeof(UNTRANSFORMED_UNLIT_VERTEX),
01336                 D3DUSAGE_WRITEONLY, UNTRANSFORMED_UNLIT_VERTEX::FVF,
01337         D3DPOOL_MANAGED, &m_pVerts, NULL ) ) )
01338     {
01339         return E_FAIL;
01340     }
01341 
01342     // Fill the vertex buffer. We are setting the tu and tv texture
01343     // coordinates, which range from 0.0 to 1.0
01344     UNTRANSFORMED_UNLIT_VERTEX* pVertices;
01345     if( FAILED( m_pVerts->Lock( 0, 0, (void**)&pVertices, 0 ) ) )
01346         return E_FAIL;
01347 
01348         for( DWORD j=0; j<m_numVerts; j++ )
01349     {
01350                 UNTRANSFORMED_UNLIT_VERTEX *vert = &pVertices[j];
01351                 vert->diffuse    = m_color;
01352                 vert->specular    = 0x00ffffff;
01353         }
01354 
01355         for (DWORD face=0; face<m_numPolys / 2; ++face )
01356         {
01357                 UNTRANSFORMED_UNLIT_VERTEX* v = &pVertices[face * 4];
01358                 v->position = g_TestObjectVerts[g_TestObjectIndices[face][0]];
01359                 (v+1)->position = g_TestObjectVerts[g_TestObjectIndices[face][1]];
01360                 (v+2)->position = g_TestObjectVerts[g_TestObjectIndices[face][2]];      
01361                 (v+3)->position = g_TestObjectVerts[g_TestObjectIndices[face][3]];
01362 
01363                 Vec3 a = v->position - (v+1)->position;
01364                 Vec3 b = (v+2)->position - (v+1)->position;
01365 
01366                 Vec3 cross = a.Cross(b);
01367                 cross /= cross.Length();
01368                 v->normal = cross;
01369                 (v+1)->normal = cross;
01370                 (v+2)->normal = cross;
01371                 (v+3)->normal = cross;
01372         }
01373 
01374         m_pVerts->Unlock();
01375 
01376         return S_OK;
01377 }
01378 
01379 HRESULT TestObject::VRender(Scene *pScene)
01380 {
01381         if (S_OK != SceneNode::VRender(pScene) )
01382                 return E_FAIL;
01383 
01384         // This is slightly different from the Chapter 7 implementation...
01385 
01386         DWORD oldCullMode;
01387         DXUTGetD3DDevice()->GetRenderState( D3DRS_CULLMODE, &oldCullMode );
01388         DXUTGetD3DDevice()->SetRenderState( D3DRS_CULLMODE, D3DCULL_CW );
01389         DXUTGetD3DDevice()->SetTexture (0, NULL);
01390 
01391         // Setup our texture. Using textures introduces the texture stage states,
01392     // which govern how textures get blended together (in the case of multiple
01393     // textures) and lighting information. In this case, we are modulating
01394     // (blending) our texture with the diffuse color of the vertices.
01395 
01396         DXUTGetD3DDevice()->SetStreamSource( 0, m_pVerts, 0, sizeof(UNTRANSFORMED_UNLIT_VERTEX) );
01397         DXUTGetD3DDevice()->SetFVF( UNTRANSFORMED_UNLIT_VERTEX::FVF );
01398 
01399         for (DWORD side = 0; side < 6; side++)
01400         {
01401                 DXUTGetD3DDevice()->DrawPrimitive( D3DPT_TRIANGLESTRIP , 4 * side, 2);
01402         }
01403 
01404 
01405         // Notice that the render states are returned to 
01406         // their original settings.....
01407         // Could there be a better way???
01408 
01409         DXUTGetD3DDevice()->SetRenderState( D3DRS_CULLMODE, oldCullMode );
01410 
01411         return S_OK;
01412 }
01413 
01414 #define CUBE_SIDES (6)
01415 
01416 TriangleIterator *TestObject::CreateTriangleIterator()
01417 {
01418         TriangleIterator *ti = GCC_NEW TriangleIterator;
01419         int triCountList[CUBE_SIDES];
01420         for (int i=0; i<CUBE_SIDES; ++i)
01421                 triCountList[i] = 2;
01422 
01423         ti->InitializeStrippedMesh(m_pVerts, sizeof(UNTRANSFORMED_UNLIT_VERTEX), CUBE_SIDES, triCountList );
01424 
01425         return ti;
01426 }

01434 // MovementController Implementation - added post press
01436 
01437 #define MAX(a, b) ((a) >= (b) ? (a) : (b))
01438 #define MIN(a, b) ((a) < (b) ? (a) : (b))
01439 
01440 #define RADIANS_TO_DEGREES(x) ((x) * 180.0f / D3DX_PI)
01441 #define DEGREES_TO_RADIANS(x) ((x) * D3DX_PI / 180.0f)
01442 
01443 MovementController::MovementController(shared_ptr<SceneNode> object, float initialYaw, float initialPitch)
01444 : m_object(object)
01445 {
01446         m_object->VGet()->Transform(&m_matToWorld, &m_matFromWorld);
01447 
01448         m_fTargetYaw = m_fYaw = RADIANS_TO_DEGREES(-initialYaw);
01449         m_fTargetPitch = m_fPitch = RADIANS_TO_DEGREES(initialPitch);
01450 
01451         m_maxSpeed = 30.0f;                     // 30 meters per second
01452         m_currentSpeed = 0.0f;
01453 
01454         Vec3 pos = m_matToWorld.GetPosition();
01455 
01456         m_matPosition.BuildTranslation(pos);
01457 
01458         //m_bLeftMouseDown = false;
01459     POINT ptCursor;
01460     GetCursorPos( &ptCursor );
01461         m_lastMousePos = ptCursor;
01462 
01463         memset(m_bKey, 0x00, sizeof(m_bKey));
01464 }
01465 
01466 
01467 bool MovementController::VOnMouseMove(const CPoint &mousePos)
01468 {
01469         if(m_lastMousePos!=mousePos)
01470         {
01471                 m_fTargetYaw = m_fTargetYaw + (m_lastMousePos.x - mousePos.x);
01472                 m_fTargetPitch = m_fTargetPitch + (mousePos.y - m_lastMousePos.y);
01473                 m_lastMousePos = mousePos;
01474         }
01475         return true;
01476 }

01483         //m_fYawOnDown = m_fTargetYaw;
01484         //m_fPitchOnDown = m_fTargetPitch;
01485         return true;
01486 }
01487 
01488 bool MovementController::VOnLButtonUp(const CPoint &)
01489 {
01490         //m_bLeftMouseDown = false;
01491         return true;
01492 }

01494 
01495 void MovementController::OnUpdate(DWORD const deltaMilliseconds)
01496 {
01497         //if (m_bKey['Q'])
01498         //{
01499         //      // This code is a cheat to position the camera exactly in a given
01500         //      // spot so I can take screen shots!
01501 
01502         //      Mat4x4 camTranslate;
01503         //      D3DXMatrixTranslation(&m_matPosition, 8.847f, 7.055f, 11.618f);
01504 
01505         //      m_fTargetYaw = m_fYaw += -64.35f;
01506         //      m_fTargetPitch = m_fPitch = 28.57f;
01507 
01508         //      // Calculate the new rotation matrix from the camera
01509         //      // yaw and pitch.
01510         //      Mat4x4 matRot;
01511         //      D3DXMatrixRotationYawPitchRoll(&matRot, DEGREES_TO_RADIANS(m_fYaw), DEGREES_TO_RADIANS(m_fPitch), 0);
01512 
01513         //      // Create the new object-to-world matrix, and the
01514         //      // new world-to-object matrix. 
01515         //      D3DXMatrixMultiply(&m_matToWorld, &matRot, &m_matPosition);
01516         //      D3DXMatrixInverse(&m_matFromWorld, NULL, &m_matToWorld);
01517 
01518         //      m_object->VSetTransform(&m_matToWorld, &m_matFromWorld);
01519         //      return;
01520         //}
01521 
01522         bool bTranslating = false;
01523         Vec4 atWorld(0,0,0,0);
01524         Vec4 rightWorld(0,0,0,0);
01525         Vec4 upWorld(0,0,0,0);
01526 
01527         if (m_bKey['W'] || m_bKey['S'])
01528         {
01529                 // In D3D, the "look at" default is always
01530                 // the positive Z axis.
01531                 Vec4 at = g_Forward4; 
01532                 if (m_bKey['S'])
01533                         at *= -1;
01534 
01535                 // This will give us the "look at" vector 
01536                 // in world space - we'll use that to move
01537                 // the camera.
01538                 atWorld = m_matToWorld.Xform(at);
01539                 bTranslating = true;
01540         }
01541 
01542         if (m_bKey['A'] || m_bKey['D'])
01543         {
01544                 // In D3D, the "right" default is always
01545                 // the positive X axis.
01546                 Vec4 right = g_Right4; 
01547                 if (m_bKey['A'])
01548                         right *= -1;
01549 
01550                 // This will give us the "right" vector 
01551                 // in world space - we'll use that to move
01552                 // the camera
01553                 rightWorld = m_matToWorld.Xform(right);
01554                 bTranslating = true;
01555         }
01556 
01557         if (m_bKey[' '] || m_bKey['C'] || m_bKey['X'])
01558         {
01559                 // In D3D, the "up" default is always
01560                 // the positive Y axis.
01561                 Vec4 up = g_Right4; 
01562                 if (!m_bKey[' '])
01563                         up *= -1;
01564 
01565                 //Unlike strafing, Up is always up no matter
01566                 //which way you are looking
01567                 upWorld = up;
01568                 bTranslating = true;
01569         }
01570 
01571         //Handling rotation as a result of mouse position
01572         {
01573                 // The secret formula!!! Don't give it away!
01574                 //If you are seeing this now, then you must be some kind of elite hacker!
01575                 m_fYaw += (m_fTargetYaw - m_fYaw) * ( .35f );
01576                 m_fTargetPitch = MAX(-90, MIN(90, m_fTargetPitch));
01577                 m_fPitch += (m_fTargetPitch - m_fPitch) * ( .35f );
01578 
01579                 // Calculate the new rotation matrix from the camera
01580                 // yaw and pitch.
01581                 Mat4x4 matRot;
01582                 matRot.BuildYawPitchRoll(DEGREES_TO_RADIANS(-m_fYaw), DEGREES_TO_RADIANS(m_fPitch), 0);
01583 
01584                 // Create the new object-to-world matrix, and the
01585                 // new world-to-object matrix. 
01586 
01587                 m_matToWorld = matRot * m_matPosition;
01588                 m_matFromWorld = m_matToWorld.Inverse(); 
01589                 m_object->VSetTransform(&m_matToWorld, &m_matFromWorld);
01590         }
01591 
01592         if (bTranslating)
01593         {
01594                 float elapsedTime = (float)deltaMilliseconds / 1000.0f;
01595 
01596                 Vec3 direction = atWorld + rightWorld + upWorld;
01597                 direction.Normalize(); 
01598 
01599                 // Ramp the acceleration by the elapsed time.
01600                 float numberOfSeconds = 5.f;
01601                 m_currentSpeed += m_maxSpeed * ( (elapsedTime*elapsedTime) / numberOfSeconds);
01602                 if (m_currentSpeed > m_maxSpeed)
01603                         m_currentSpeed = m_maxSpeed;
01604 
01605                 direction *= m_currentSpeed;
01606 
01607                 Vec3 pos = m_matPosition.GetPosition() + direction;
01608                 m_matPosition.SetPosition(pos);
01609                 m_matToWorld.SetPosition(pos);
01610 
01611                 m_matFromWorld = m_matToWorld.Inverse();
01612                 m_object->VSetTransform(&m_matToWorld, &m_matFromWorld);
01613         }
01614         else
01615         {
01616                 m_currentSpeed = 0.0f;
01617         }
01618 }
